nodes.text: Dataplaques were ancient information storage devices. Consisting in storage rods built into a capacitance board made of precious metal, they were notably used to contain astrogational data, in which case they were called navigational dataplaques.

The gangster Dryden Vos kept two finely adorned navigational dataplaques in his personal museum onboard the star yacht First Light. One allegedly pinpointed the location of the long-lost Queen of Ranroon ship. The other, which he had stolen from the Bureau of Ships and Services Heritage Museum on Coruscant and replaced with a forgery, was thought to have come from an old Jedi scout ship, the Permondiri Explorer.
Around 34 ABY, the Ithorian collector Dok-Ondar kept a number of dataplaques at his store on Batuu.
